Package application

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
application.Controller
public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
Stores information entered by user from GUI and processes Events. This class is responsible for implementing the functionality of the GUI and responding to events. Buttons and text fields are updated dynamically based on user selections.
Author:
Matthew Brandao, Armit Patel

  • Method Details

    • addEmployee

      private void addEmployee​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Function that confirms all entries for adding an employee are Valid. Passes valid entries to employeeHelper.
      Parameters:
      event - action that fired this event

    • employeeHelper

      private void employeeHelper​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String department, Date dateHired, java.lang.String employeeType)
      Helper function that takes employee input and distinguishes between types of employee to add to the database. Performs error handling to ensure for all types of employees the input is valid.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the employee
      department - the department of the employee
      dateHired - the date hired of the employee
      employeeType - the type of employee

    • clearFields

      private void clearFields​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Clears all fields of the GUI. Radio buttons are not effected.
      Parameters:
      event - action that fired this event

    • computePayments

      private void computePayments​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Checks if the company database is empty, otherwise processes payments and outputs a message to the text area displaying attempt result.
      Parameters:
      event - action that fired this event

    • exportFile

      private void exportFile​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles all attempts to export the employee database to a text file on to the local machine. The only format allowed for export is the *.txt extension. The function will not allow users to export databases that are empty.
      Parameters:
      event - action that fired this event

    • importFile

      private void importFile​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Handles all attempts to import an employee database to the current database. The only file formats allowed for import are of the *.txt extension. Upon successful import the current database is not overwritten. The new employees from the text file are appended to the current database. This function also handles cases where the contents of the import file are invalid.
      Parameters:
      event - action that fired this event
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException

    • printByDate

      private void printByDate​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Checks if employee database is empty, otherwise prints earnings statements sorted by Date in ascending order to the text area of the GUI.
      Parameters:
      event - action that fired this event

    • printByDepartment

      private void printByDepartment​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Checks if employee database is empty, otherwise prints earnings statements sorted by Department to the text area of the GUI.
      Parameters:
      event - action that fired this event

    • printEmployees

      private void printEmployees​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Checks if employee database is empty, otherwise prints earnings statements of the current state of the database to the text area of the GUI.
      Parameters:
      event - action that fired this event

    • removeEmployee

      private void removeEmployee​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Collects input fields from the GUI and removes employee from the database. Performs error handling to make sure the user is attempting to remove an employee in situations where such an action is allowed.
      Parameters:
      event - action that fired this event

    • setHours

      private void setHours​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Collects input from GUI and sets hours for a Parttime employee. Performs error handling to make sure the user is attempting to set the hours in situations where such an action is allowed.
      Parameters:
      event - action that fired this event

    • selectFullRB

      private void selectFullRB​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Updates GUI form when FullTime employee is selected.
      Parameters:
      event - action that fired this event
